page.title: 15BUILDINGS _ KIRKNEWTON
page.content:
Village Hall was formally the primary school building.Currently requiring extensive renovation to meet standards of safety and comfort required by local authority in order to be granted a licence to hold functions. There are four large houses in the area; Kilham Farmhouse,Westnewton House,Kirknewton House and the Old Vicarage. There are farm workers' cottages adjacent to these houses.
The former railway station and station master's house are now private residences,as are the former school house and railway cottages. Some former farm workers' cottages are now used as holiday homes.
Most buildings are built with local stone.
